statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

article.description: Toni Kukoc scored a season-high 24 points off the bench as the Atlanta Hawks earned a rare road victory, 105-96 over the Cleveland Cavaliers.
article.headline: Ballboy no obstacle to Hawks' second road win

images.name: Templin, Mike 011129 inline
images.caption: Cavs ballboy Mike Templin found himself on the business end of a fast break.

article.linkText: Ballboy, Cavaliers take beating from Hawks
article.story:
CLEVELAND (AP) -- The kid with the mop did a better job slowing Jacque Vaughn than the Cleveland Cavaliers did against Toni Kukoc. Kukoc scored a season-high 24 points, Shareef Abdur-Rahim added 19 and the Atlanta Hawks won for just the second time on the road this season, 105-96 over the Cavaliers on Thursday night. Kukoc and Vaughn rallied the Hawks from a 13-point deficit in the first half and Atlanta held off a late rally by Cleveland to improve to 2-9 on the road. Vaughn also provided the game's most comical moment -- and one destined for the highlight hall of fame -- when he pushed a ball boy to the floor while scoring a basket in the first half. "I know we'll be seeing that one on TV for sure," said Kukoc. "That was pretty funny." Nazr Mohammed added 16 points and 14 rebounds, and Emanual Davis 15 points, including a key 3-pointer with 3:52 left that gave the Hawks a 97-91 lead and put away the Cavs. Kukoc, who scored just one point in a loss to New York on Wednesday night, was 8-of-11 from the floor. He had six assists and four steals as Atlanta's bench outscored Cleveland's reserves 43-14. Kukoc, recently on the injured list with a quadriceps injury, said he is just now starting to get his timing down. "I felt pretty good right from the start tonight, and the game opened up for me," he said. "My basketball shape is coming back to me." Cavs coach John Lucas warned his team about letting Kukoc get on a roll. "The one thing I told the guys is, if Kukoc comes in, don't let him get started," Lucas said. "The first thing we do is leave him wide open. I told our coaches, 'That's ballgame.'" Lamond Murray scored 19 points, Wes Person 18 -- 16 in the first quarter -- and Jumaine Jones had 17 points and 12 rebounds for Cleveland, which scored 37 points in the opening period before being limited to 39 over the next two when the Hawks decided to play defense. "We talked about playing better defense," Vaughn said. "It was addressed at halftime. We dug ourselves a pretty big hole, but fortunately our bench helped us get out of it." Mohammed's three-point play with 5:33 remaining gave Atlanta a 94-86 lead, but the Cavs scored five straight to close within three on Andre Miller's two free throws. Davis then buried a 3-pointer from the right side and Kukoc scored Atlanta's next two buckets to make it 99-91 with 3:26 left. After Kukoc made two free throws to bring Atlanta within 51-40 in the second quarter, Vaughn made a steal near midcourt and drove to the basket, where an unsuspecting ball boy was mopping the lane. In one motion, Vaughn gently pushed the scrambling kid out of the way and made a layup. Vaughn quickly checked to make sure the 16-year-old was OK before heading up court. "I had two objectives," Vaughn said. "I wanted to score and I wanted to make sure we were both safe. It all ended up being OK." Lucas said when he played, the kid might not have been so lucky. "Back in the old days, we would have run him over," Lucas said. "The thing that impressed me was the guys down there were concerned for the kid. We never would have done that." Vaughn's unlikely basket came early in a 16-3 run that helped the Hawks pull within 60-58 at halftime after trailing by 13. Person made seven free throws and scored 16 points as the Cavs scored a season-high 37 in the first quarter to open an 11-point lead.

Game notes
Cavs C Michael Doleac was diagnosed with a stress fracture in his left foot. He will be examined again on Friday. Doleac, acquired on draft day from Orlando to fill in while Zydrunas Ilgauskas recovers from his fifth foot surgery, said surgery has been discussed. ... Vaughn is 37-for-61 from the field since missing his first 22 shots to start the season. ... Lucas said rookie C DeSagana Diop could play again in the next 10 days. Diop has been out since the opener with a strained knee ligament. ... Cleveland didn't make its first turnover until 9:55 remained in the second quarter. The Cavs ended up allowing 23 points on 14 turnovers.
